entry.title: Re: KSBB new features in S4 hana
entry.content:
I ran the transaction in my S/4HANA system and got this:

The long text shows this:

Report trees are obsolete - function to be deactivated

Message No. KN250

Diagnosis

Report calls using report trees are obsolete. The function will be deactivated permanently with the next release.

 

Procedure

To call up reports, please use role maintenance (transaction PFCG).

entry.title: Re: Ad hoc Query/Report Creation in SAP
entry.content:
EPI-Use has Query manager that works well with SAP HCM tables.

I like SAP SQ01 ad hoc query; you still need to know the tables and joins.

If the CDS views are already built, SAP Analysis Office is good to work with.

entry.title: Re: SAP MM Cerificate selection
entry.content: I recommend starting with this one: https://learning.sap.com/certifications/sap-certified-associate-sap-s-4hana-sourcing-and-procurement

entry.title: Re: Where can I find business process BPMN diagrams relev...
entry.content:
Hello - I don't think they are available for all solutions / industries.

There appear to be a lot for Ariba

entry.title: Blog it forward - third time's a charm
entry.content:
I attended SAP Insider in Las Vegas this year, and I was asked why I haven't blogged for a while.  Well a few reasons - I had an injury that stopped me from writing (now fully recovered) and I was super busy on an Ariba project that included weekend work.

Now on to more fun things:

I am still ASUG chapter chair for the Mid-Atlantic region.  We are seeking speakers and sponsors for our upcoming events in September (Richmond, VA) and December in Baltimore.  This year ASUG honored me as volunteer of the year.

In my spare time, I still like to walk and crochet.   I finished a 3 year stint as a Finance volunteer for my local PMI Washington DC chapter; we left the chapter in great financial shape. 

Since the last blog-it-forward, we have upgraded to S/4HANA 2022 and implemented SAP Service Cloud (in addition to Ariba).  At work I support the finance areas, security, Solution Manager, now Ariba and other projects.  It's never a dull moment at work.

In terms of SAP TechEd, I miss the in person "SAP Community Family Reunion" as Mark Yolton called it.  I found this article that ASUG wrote about it and it's all still relevant today.  During COVID times, I joined TechEd remotely - you can see the YouTube here: 

I also enjoyed the virtual TechEds remotely in Europe or India, and many times woke up early to catch the keynotes.

Now on to some non-SAP topics - famous people I've seen or met:

1. Connie Chung and Maury Povich - they were on my very first flight to New York City

2. Former speaker of the house Newt Gingrich - seen him several times at old National Airport.  I last saw him across the aisle on a plane when I flew back from ASUG Chicago a few years ago.

3. Senator Bob Dole - my first job in a nursing home as a teenager he visited the place no less than 3 times.

4. Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy - he sat next to me on a flight from San Francisco to Washington Dulles.  He was a gentleman who offered to help me with my luggage.

5. Michael Strahan - I met him in person at ASUG Annual Conference, thanks to ASUG

6. Steve Wozniak - founder of Apple - I met him at ASUG Annual Conference

7. Maurice DuBois - CBS News co-anchor - I've seen him several times on the street when I was working in New York City

8. On many flights from Washington DC to Kansas City (or visa-versa) I've seen the Governor of Missouri, US Senators from Kansas, and local Kansas congressmen.

9. Gloria Loring - she sang and wrote the song for "Facts of Life" and was an actress on Days of Our Lives - she was on my flight to Chicago from Washington, DC

10. Susan Lucci  - she was on my flight from Washington Reagan to New York LaGuardia

Favorite TV Shows by Decade:

1. 60's - Bewitched

2. 70's Mary Tyler Moore Show

3. 80's - couldn't think of one; Cheers, maybe?  I remember Woody asking Norm how his day was going and he said "Woody, it's a dog-eat-dog world and I'm wearing Milk-Bone dog underwear".

4. 90's Seinfeld

5. 2000's - Gilmore Girls

6. 2010 - Modern Family

What are your favorite shows?

entry.title: Re: What tips would you give an organisation planning to...
entry.content:
A bad one would be a "build it and they will come" adoption plan, because they won't come.

A good one, I heard from another company, is to train all new users in Fiori.  I think that would be a good adoption plan.

entry.title: Re: Blog it forward - third time's a charm
entry.content:
I forgot to mention more famous people I've seen or run into:

1. Former vice president Kamala Harris - I saw her in 2019 in the women's restroom at Reagan National airport.  She was on her way to campaign in New Hampshire.  Of course I didn't say anything.

2. Al Roker, Today show - I used to do work in NYC on Madison and Fifth Avenue and walk by the Today Show every day on the way to work.  This time I saw him on the way back from work, wearing a cowboy hat.

entry.title: Re: API for Settlement rule creation in WBS Element
entry.content:
I don't think there is an API.

Simone offers a possible solution here: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/bapi-to-create-and-delete-settlement-rules-in-wbs-element/qaq-p/683325/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/bapi-to-create-and-delete-settlement-rules-in-wbs-element/qaq-p/683325

In the past I have used LSMW's but I am not a fan of those generally.

entry.title: Re: Recap Series: SAP Community members speaking at SAP Sapphire 2025
entry.content:
Nice to meet you.

I work at a water utility in Northern Virginia (just outside the Washington DC Beltway), providing SAP support in many areas, including security, finance, Solution Manager, etc.

Our water utility provides water to 1 in 4 people in the great state of Virginia.

I participate in the SAP ecosystem by being an ASUG volunteer and on the advisory panel for SAP for Utilities coming soon in September.

Later this month, I will be participating in a firehouse caucus

entry.title: Re: How to transport changes in SAP Query
entry.content:
#3 you only need to do if you are NOT transporting.

I always regenerate the program myself after transporting the query

entry.title: Re: How to transport changes in SAP Query
entry.content: I think it's a best practice to do that.  I always do it.  Technically the transport should generate the program but to be on the safe side, I would generate it

entry.title: Re: In SAP Learning Hub, is BDC, SAC, Datasphere, S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hi Mel - I in the Learning Hub practice sessions, I see SAC, S/4HANA Private, BW/4HANA

I do not see any Datasphere or SAP Databricks; I recommend going to https://learninghub.sap.com/help-center and clicking the ? and selecting one of the "contact us" options.

entry.title: Be the U in SAP 4 U - SAP for Utilities in September
entry.content:
I am looking forward to SAP for Utilities, produced by ASUG, in September in Denver, Colorado.

Source: ASUG

Top reasons to attend:

  1. Community meetups:

Last year we held meetups for Water utilities, Canadian utilities, electric – here’s a look back at what as discussed for Water utilities:

 

We will discuss what you want to discuss.  Take this opportunity to share and learn best practices from your peers.

 

  1. Hear from other utilities, just like yours. 

Discover how leading utilities are embracing cutting-edge technologies to transform and streamline their operations. Learn how SAP innovations are driving business simplification

 

  1. Visit  showcase of SAP solutions tailored for utilities.

Head to the exhibition hall to experience live demos, engage in expert-led discussions, and connect with exhibitors offering cutting-edge technologies, support services, software innovations and hosting options.

 

 

Gather Insights from Customer Stories:

 

  • Hear from Consumers Energy explore their SAP S/4HANA launch playbook—covering everything from internal buy-in and scope alignment to financial and regulatory approvals, team mobilization, and organizational change—based on their journey since May 2024.
  • Join Dominion Energy to explore their SAP S/4HANA EAM journey, highlighting how innovation, metrics, and a growth mindset have fostered organizational change, employee empowerment, and increased solution adoption.
  • Learn from Eversource to hear their CIS transformation enhanced address validation—improving billing accuracy, reducing fraud and safety risks, and ensuring regulatory compliance and efficient service delivery.
  • Join the OGE (Oklahoma Gas and Electric) session “Through the Breach – Security and Compliance in the Shared Responsibility Model” to explore how RISE with SAP delivers transformative technological and procedural advancements that strengthen organizational security and compliance.
  • Attend PG&E (Pacific Gas & Electric) to explore their Clean Core transformation with RISE with SAP—highlighting their shift from a complex legacy ERP to a modern, agile system through fit-to-standard principles, stakeholder alignment, and enterprise design that supports decarbonization, regulatory compliance, and customer-focused innovation.
  • Southern California Edison presents its Next Gen ERP, showcasing how SAP S/4HANA is fueling innovation, advancing sustainability goals, and driving operational excellence—raising business unit maturity to the top quartile of the industry.
  • Southwest Gas features real-world insights as utilities and partners—building on their SAP CX 1.0 successes—collaborate to shape SAP CX 2.0 with forward-looking architecture, increased extensibility, and modern development strategies.
  • DTE Energy shares how integrating SAP CDP with SAP Emarsys is transforming customer engagement by unifying fragmented data, automating processes, and eliminating silos to enhance operational efficiency.
  • PG&E and SAP address the growing complexity of New Load Connections and Electric Generation Interconnections, spotlighting how utilities are streamlining these critical processes amid California’s rapid energy transition and rising customer electrification. (note: first time I recall an important topic like this is discussed at a conference).
  • OG&E (along with fellow SAP Mentor Diego Dora) showcases how generative AI-powered tools helped overcome delivery challenges in their SAP S/4HANA transformation—automating and governing critical lifecycle processes to accelerate results without compromising quality.
  • Eugene Water & Electric Board showcases how their cloud-based SAP S/4HANA implementation is unlocking the Clean Core strategy—enhancing resiliency, automating operations, and optimizing processes across finance, customer service, and meter-to-cash.
  • Discover how Loudoun Water’s Jeff Smith leveraged his experience at Fairfax Water to implement reporting enhancements that increase visibility and improve EAM Master Data
  • UGI Utilities shares how a decade of technology modernization revealed integration challenges that ultimately led to a strategic shift toward a unified financial platform using SAP solutions.
  • Chesapeake Utilities Corporation highlights its transformation of Customer and Field Services by modernizing its Customer Information platform, integrating Florida City Gas, and leveraging RISE with SAP and SAP BTP Enterprise Asset Management to enhance customer experiences and application hosting.
  • Discover how SAP C4C V2 enhancements are tailored for SoCalGas—integrating industry-specific use cases to elevate end-user experience, operational efficiency, and customer engagement.
  • London Hydro shares its end-to-end Greenfield CIS transformation with SAP S/4HANA—focused on modernizing billing through dual contract conversion, streamlining customer communications, and advancing its vision as a digital-first utility in partnership with TCS.
  • Southwest Gas showcases its digital transformation in field operations using SAP BTP, SuccessFactors, and Concur to optimize operational efficiency through automated expense reporting and streamlined training management with QR code-enabled access.

Not a customer session but an important session from SAP:

  • Explore SAP's future-ready service management, where the planned sunset of legacy CS features by 2030 prompts utilities to understand evolving capabilities, retained functions, and new innovations within SAP S/4HANA.

 

Register today: https://events.asug.com/event/SAP-For-Utilities-2025/agenda

Hope to see you in Denver in September.  Do you have any must-see sessions?

entry.title: Re: Need advice and pointers to update on my classic ABAP skill
entry.content: I know ADT is big, CDS views, but also ABAP Cloud and "clean core".  You can check the free Learning Journeys here: https://learning.sap.com/courses/introduction-to-abap-in-the-cloud

entry.title: Re: Exploring Innovation: Discover What's New in the SAP Utilities Community
entry.content:
Hi Nicole,

I really enjoy this newsletter—it always has useful updates and fresh content. It’s a great way to stay in the "know" with what’s happening in the SAP Utilities community.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Top 3 reasons to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
I'll be there "in spirit".  

WWMPD?  What would Marilyn Pratt do?

I remember my first in person SAP TechEd - I was shy, didn't know my way around the Las Vegas hotel.

I my last in person one was 2019.  So long ago.  I hope you have wonderful family reunion.
